oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Dr. William A. Shaw to Bishop Leonidas Polk
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this letter, Dr. Shaw wrote of his gratification in beholding Polk's "commanding position in our Southern Army." He commented at length on the political causes of the war, "this Northern crusade of fanaticism and avarice against the Southern States." The Confederate nation will have a future "far eclipsing the former renown and prosperity of the old. U.S., which is now corrupt, effete, and forever decomposed," and included a patriotic poem "dedicated to Major General Leonidas Polk."
